scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production web app in West Europe with ~50k MAU, 2x Linux VMs (PAYG), Azure SQL Database, Azure Cache for Redis, Blob Storage, one Public IP, basic networking, security, monitoring and backup. Target 99.9% uptime.

resources.notes: Single production VNet in West Europe hosting web tier and private endpoints. No direct VNet cost but required for network topology and security alignment with CAF.

Two Linux VMs (Standard_D2s_v3) in an availability set or across zones for 99.9% uptime. 64 GB OS disk per VM assumed (billed separately as managed disks). Egress estimate 200 GB/month for web traffic. PAYG as requested.
resources.error: Price not found for requested SKU

resources.notes: Premium SSD P6 (64 GB) OS disks for each VM. Assumes standard premium SSD for balanced performance and reliability.

Azure SQL Database Single DB, General Purpose, Gen5, 2 vCores. 128 GB storage assumed. Zone redundancy not explicitly priced; can be enabled if required. Egress 50 GB/month for data access outside region.

resources.notes: Azure Cache for Redis Standard C1 for session/state caching and performance. Assumes moderate operations volume and intra-region traffic primarily.
Blob Storage account for static assets. 200 GB hot, 50 GB cool assumed. LRS redundancy. Egress 300 GB/month for content delivery to internet users.

resources.notes: Azure Key Vault Standard for secrets, keys, and certificates used by VMs and app. Operation count estimated for connection strings and TLS cert access.
Log Analytics workspace for VM, SQL, and platform logs. 100 GB/month ingestion assumed with default retention.
Azure Backup vault protecting 2 VMs and SQL DB with daily backups. 300 GB backup storage assumed including retention.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized (1-year Reserved VMs)
scenarios.description: Same architecture as baseline but 2x Linux VMs on 1-year Reserved Instances to reduce compute cost. Other services remain PAYG.

resources.notes: Same VNet as baseline. No reservation concept for VNet; billing_model reserved here is irrelevant but kept consistent.
Two Linux VMs (Standard_D2s_v3) covered by 1-year Reserved Instances in West Europe. Same sizing as baseline but lower hourly rate.

scenarios.label: High Performance
scenarios.description: Production web app with 2x higher-performance Windows VMs (same Dsv3 family but larger size), PAYG. Same Azure SQL Database, Redis, Blob Storage, and networking as baseline.

resources.notes: Same VNet topology as baseline.
Two Windows VMs, Standard_D4s_v3 (4 vCores, more RAM and throughput than D2s_v3) for higher performance. PAYG as requested. 128 GB OS disk per VM assumed.
resources.error: Price not found for requested SKU

resources.notes: Premium SSD P10 (128 GB) OS disks for each high-performance VM to match increased workload.
Same SQL DB tier as baseline; can be scaled up separately if DB becomes bottleneck.
